alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated more heavy rains due to thunderstorms working into the advisory area from the Gulf of Mexico. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier heavy rains today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Marco Island, Everglades City, Royal Palm Hammock, Marco Island Airport, Cape Romano, Belle Meade, Lely Resort, Naples Manor, East Naples, Plantation Island, Big Cypress National Preserve, Everglades National Park, Goodland, Key Marco, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Port Of The Island, Fiddlers Creek, Rookery Bay Aquatic Preserve and Lely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
